title: Man who 'held family prisoner in basement thought he was better than Jesus'
text:

The brother of a man who allegedly kept a family imprisoned in a basement says he was self-centred, involved in sects and "thought he was better than Jesus".

Josef B, 58, from Waldhausen in Austria, has been arrested after a father and his five adult children spent nine years in a cellar inside a remote farmhouse in Drenthe, Netherlands, "waiting for the end of time".

One of the siblings, Jan Zon van Dorsten, managed to flee to a nearby bar on Sunday but after ordering five beers, said he couldn't go home.

Jan's brothers and sisters are aged between 18 and 25, Dutch police say.

(Image: Facebook)



Josef's brother, Franz B., told local media that his sibling first came into contact with sects when he left home to do his military service in the army.

Franz said: "He joined a sect and thought he was better than Jesus. I have had no contact with him for ten years. I chased him off when he came and wanted me to act as a guarantor for him.

According to Franz, Josef did not even attend their own father's funeral after he died.

But when the farm was passed onto Franz who took over the running, he claims Josef came demanding his share of the inheritance.

(Image: Wilbert Bijzitter/EPA-EFE/REX)

He said: "My brother was only ever interested in what was best for him."

His mother died one and a half years ago, but it is claimed he also did not go to her funeral.

Josef also reportedly has twin daughters with a Japanese woman who are now adults.

According to the family, the twins have tried to make contact with their father since 2017 but have not heard anything.

(Image: Facebook)

The brother claims that when his daughters were younger, he left them alone with friends in Holland for months on end.

From 1998 to 2008, Josef B. lived in Pabneukirchen, Austria, in a 300-year-old house and worked as a carpenter. He was also registered at a property in Vienna.

(Image: Vincent Jannink/EPA-EFE/REX)

Police say parts of the victims' speech is incomprehensible, adding that they slept and ate on the floor of their windowless prison, according to reports.

Some of the younger family members were reportedly convinced they were the only humans on earth.
description: Josef B, 58, from Austria, has been arrested after six brothers and sisters allegedly spent nine years in the cellar in Drenthe, Netherlands, "waiting for the end of time"
